section.p: Discover a land of contrasts. From luxuriant tropical scenery to vast tracts of arid , from terraced vineyards to snow-clad ski slopes, from towering mountain peaks to deep rocky , from cool alpine streams to salt and freshwater , from small mountain villages to vibrant cosmopolitan cities - Australia has something for everyone.

Explore the lush green interior of the tropical of Queensland - home to hundreds of species of plants, birds, mammals and reptiles. Admire spectacular as they cascade into tranquil pools of crystal-clear water. Relax on the soft white sands of world-renowned , go snorkelling or scuba diving on the Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest living organism, or take a cruise around the beautiful desert that lie just off the east .

Go horse riding in the Blue Mountains of New South Wales. As you meander along towering tops, enjoy breathtaking views of the fertile river below. Stop for a picnic along the way and taste fresh produce from some of Australia's most productive .
Go climbing or skiing in the Snowy Mountains - Australia's highest and the country's winter sports playground.

Go canoeing or water skiing or take a cruise on Australia's longest , the Murray, as it wends its way from its source high in the Snowy Mountains to Encounter Bay in South Australia, where it flows into the Indian .
Visit Mount Gambier, just one of the many extinct in South Australia, and enjoy stunning views of the surrounding countryside from the crater.
Or visit a World Heritage site - two jutting out into Shark Bay in Western Australia, where the action centres on a group of dolphins that have a taste for human contact.
